articles.title: Les temps verbaux anglais expliqu√©s simplement
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Les temps verbaux anglais peuvent sembler compliqu√©s au d√©but, mais une fois que vous comprenez la logique, tout devient plus clair ! D√©couvrons ensemble les principaux temps et comment les utiliser dans vos conversations de couple.

## Le pr√©sent simple

Le pr√©sent simple exprime les habitudes, les v√©rit√©s g√©n√©rales et les sentiments permanents.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="I love you"
  translation="Je t'aime"
  pronunciation="a√Ø leuv you"
  context="Sentiment permanent = pr√©sent simple"
/>

<ConjugationTable
  verb="to love"
  meaning="aimer"
  conjugations={[
    { "person": "I", "word": "love", "translation": "J'aime" },
    { "person": "You", "word": "love", "translation": "Tu aimes" },
    { "person": "He/She", "word": "loves", "translation": "Il/Elle aime" },
    { "person": "We", "word": "love", "translation": "Nous aimons" },
    { "person": "They", "word": "love", "translation": "Ils/Elles aiment" }
  ]}
/>

### Quand utiliser le pr√©sent simple

| Utilisation | Exemple | Traduction |
|-------------|---------|------------|
| Habitudes | I wake up at 7am | Je me r√©veille √† 7h |
| V√©rit√©s g√©n√©rales | The sun rises in the east | Le soleil se l√®ve √† l'est |
| Sentiments | I love Italian food | J'adore la cuisine italienne |
| Horaires | The train leaves at 9pm | Le train part √† 21h |

<VocabCard
  word="We always have dinner together"
  translation="Nous d√Ænons toujours ensemble"
  pronunciation="oui OL-ou√©√Øz hav DI-neur teuh-G√à-theur"
  example="We always have dinner together on Sundays."
/>

## Le pr√©sent continu (be + -ing)

Le pr√©sent continu d√©crit une action en cours au moment o√π l'on parle.

<VocabCard
  word="I am cooking dinner"
  translation="Je suis en train de pr√©parer le d√Æner"
  pronunciation="a√Ø am KOU-king DI-neur"
  example="I am cooking dinner for us right now."
/>

### Formation

| Sujet | Be | Verbe + ing | Exemple |
|-------|-----|-------------|---------|
| I | am | working | I am working |
| You/We/They | are | sleeping | They are sleeping |
| He/She | is | reading | She is reading |

<CultureTip title="Erreur fr√©quente des Fran√ßais" flag="üá¨üáß">
N'utilisez pas le pr√©sent continu pour les sentiments et √©tats permanents ! On ne dit pas ¬´ I am loving you ¬ª mais ¬´ I love you ¬ª. Les verbes comme love, know, want, need, believe s'utilisent au pr√©sent simple.
</CultureTip>

## Le pass√© simple (Past Simple)

Le pass√© simple d√©crit des actions termin√©es dans le pass√©.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="We met three years ago"
  translation="Nous nous sommes rencontr√©s il y a trois ans"
  pronunciation="oui m√®t thri yirz euh-GO"
  context="Action termin√©e √† un moment pr√©cis du pass√©"
/>

### Verbes r√©guliers et irr√©guliers

| Type | Base | Pass√© | Exemple |
|------|------|-------|---------|
| R√©gulier | love | loved | I loved the movie |
| R√©gulier | walk | walked | We walked on the beach |
| Irr√©gulier | meet | met | We met at a party |
| Irr√©gulier | go | went | We went to Paris |
| Irr√©gulier | have | had | We had a wonderful time |

<VocabCard
  word="I fell in love with you instantly"
  translation="Je suis tomb√©(e) amoureux/amoureuse de toi instantan√©ment"
  pronunciation="a√Ø f√®l in leuv ouith you IN-steunt-li"
  example="The moment I saw you, I fell in love."
/>

## Le pr√©sent parfait (Present Perfect)

Le pr√©sent parfait relie le pass√© au pr√©sent. Il exprime une exp√©rience ou une action qui a des cons√©quences maintenant.

<VocabCard
  word="I have loved you since we met"
  translation="Je t'aime depuis notre rencontre"
  pronunciation="a√Ø hav leuvd you sins oui m√®t"
  example="Action commenc√©e dans le pass√© qui continue maintenant"
/>

### Formation : have/has + participe pass√©

| Sujet | Auxiliaire | Participe pass√© | Exemple |
|-------|------------|-----------------|---------|
| I/You/We/They | have | been | I have been happy |
| He/She | has | visited | She has visited London |

### Pass√© simple vs Pr√©sent parfait

| Pr√©sent parfait | Pass√© simple |
|-----------------|--------------|
| I have visited Paris (exp√©rience, pas de date) | I visited Paris in 2020 (date pr√©cise) |
| We have been together for 5 years (toujours ensemble) | We were together for 5 years (c'est fini) |
| Have you ever tried sushi? (exp√©rience de vie) | Did you try sushi yesterday? (moment pr√©cis) |

<CultureTip title="Le pi√®ge franco-anglais" flag="üá¨üáß">
En fran√ßais, on utilise souvent le pass√© compos√© l√† o√π l'anglais utilise le pass√© simple. ¬´ J'ai mang√© ce matin ¬ª se traduit par ¬´ I ate this morning ¬ª (pass√© simple), pas ¬´ I have eaten this morning ¬ª.
</CultureTip>

## Le futur

### Will - d√©cisions spontan√©es et pr√©dictions

<VocabCard
  word="I will always love you"
  translation="Je t'aimerai toujours"
  pronunciation="a√Ø ouil OL-ou√©√Øz leuv you"
  example="Promise romantique pour l'avenir"
/>

### Going to - plans et intentions

<VocabCard
  word="We are going to get married"
  translation="Nous allons nous marier"
  pronunciation="oui ar GO-wing tou gu√®t MA-rid"
  example="Plan d√©cid√© pour l'avenir"
/>

### Comparaison des deux futurs

| Will | Going to |
|------|----------|
| D√©cision spontan√©e : I'll help you! | Plan : We're going to visit Spain |
| Pr√©diction : It will rain tomorrow | Intention : I'm going to learn English |
| Promesse : I will love you forever | √âvidence : Look! It's going to rain |

## Le conditionnel

<PhraseOfDay
  word="I would do anything for you"
  translation="Je ferais n'importe quoi pour toi"
  pronunciation="a√Ø woud dou √à-ni-thing for you"
  context="Would + base verbale pour le conditionnel"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Would you marry me?"
  translation="Voudrais-tu m'√©pouser ?"
  pronunciation="woud you MA-ri mi"
  example="La question la plus romantique en anglais !"
/>

## Tableau r√©capitulatif

| Temps | Structure | Exemple romantique |
|-------|-----------|-------------------|
| Pr√©sent simple | Sujet + verbe | I love you |
| Pr√©sent continu | Sujet + be + -ing | I am thinking about you |
| Pass√© simple | Sujet + verbe-ed/irr√©g. | We met in Paris |
| Pr√©sent parfait | Sujet + have + part. pass√© | I have always loved you |
| Futur (will) | Sujet + will + verbe | I will always be there |
| Futur (going to) | Sujet + be going to + verbe | We are going to be happy |
| Conditionnel | Sujet + would + verbe | I would marry you |

## Exercices pour couples

### Racontez votre histoire
Utilisez les diff√©rents temps pour raconter votre histoire d'amour en anglais. O√π vous √™tes-vous rencontr√©s ? Comment est-ce arriv√© ? Quels sont vos projets ?

### Le jeu des temps
L'un dit une phrase en fran√ßais, l'autre doit la traduire avec le bon temps en anglais.

### Journal √† deux voix
√âcrivez ensemble un petit journal de votre semaine en utilisant les diff√©rents temps.

<CultureTip title="La pratique rend parfait" flag="üá¨üáß">
Ne vous inqui√©tez pas si vous faites des erreurs avec les temps ! M√™me les anglophones natifs font parfois des fautes. L'important est de pratiquer r√©guli√®rement ensemble.
</CultureTip>

Avec de la pratique, ces temps deviendront naturels. L'avantage d'apprendre en couple, c'est que vous pouvez vous entra√Æner et vous corriger mutuellement !

<CTA text="Pr√™ts √† ma√Ætriser les temps anglais ensemble ?" buttonText="Commencer maintenant" />

articles.title: Dutch Jealousy & Trust Phrases for English Speakers
articles.content:
The Dutch value direct, honest communication‚Äîincluding when discussing sensitive topics like jealousy and trust. When you're with a Dutch speaker, knowing how to have these conversations in their language shows respect. Here are essential Dutch phrases for these important discussions.

## Expressing Jealousy

### Ik ben jaloers
**Pronunciation:** ik ben yah-LOORS

**Meaning:** "I'm jealous"

**When to use it:** To honestly admit your feelings.

### Ik word jaloers als...
**Pronunciation:** ik vort yah-LOORS ahls

**Meaning:** "I get jealous when..."

**When to use it:** To explain your triggers.

**Example:** "Ik word jaloers als je zoveel tijd met haar doorbrengt." (I get jealous when you spend so much time with her.)

### Ik vind het niet leuk dat ik zo jaloers ben
**Pronunciation:** ik vint ut neet luk daht ik zoh yah-LOORS ben

**Meaning:** "I don't like that I'm so jealous"

**When to use it:** To show self-awareness.

## Seeking Reassurance

### Hou je alleen van mij?
**Pronunciation:** how yuh ah-LAYN vahn may

**Meaning:** "Do you love only me?"

**When to use it:** When seeking reassurance.

### Ik heb behoefte aan je bevestiging
**Pronunciation:** ik hep buh-HOOF-tuh ahn yuh buh-VES-tee-ghing

**Meaning:** "I need your reassurance"

**When to use it:** When asking for comfort.

### Kun je me helpen me veiliger te voelen?
**Pronunciation:** kun yuh muh HEL-pun muh VAY-lee-gher tuh VOO-lun

**Meaning:** "Can you help me feel safer?"

**When to use it:** To ask for support.

## Building Trust

### Ik vertrouw je
**Pronunciation:** ik fur-TROW yuh

**Meaning:** "I trust you"

**When to use it:** To express trust directly.

### Ik wil je volledig vertrouwen
**Pronunciation:** ik vil yuh vohl-LAY-dikh fur-TROW-un

**Meaning:** "I want to trust you completely"

**When to use it:** When building deeper trust.

### Hoe kunnen we meer vertrouwen opbouwen?
**Pronunciation:** hoo KUH-nun vuh mayr fur-TROW-un OP-bow-un

**Meaning:** "How can we build more trust?"

**When to use it:** To strengthen trust together.

## Giving Reassurance

### Ik heb alleen oog voor jou
**Pronunciation:** ik hep ah-LAYN ohkh vohr yow

**Meaning:** "I only have eyes for you"

**When to use it:** A romantic reassurance.

### Jij bent de enige voor mij
**Pronunciation:** yay bent duh AY-nee-ghuh vohr may

**Meaning:** "You're the only one for me"

**When to use it:** To affirm commitment.

### Je hoeft je geen zorgen te maken
**Pronunciation:** yuh hooft yuh ghayn ZOR-ghun tuh MAH-kun

**Meaning:** "You don't need to worry"

**When to use it:** To calm concerns.

### Mijn hart is van jou
**Pronunciation:** mayn hahrt is vahn yow

**Meaning:** "My heart is yours"

**When to use it:** A romantic declaration.

## Setting Healthy Boundaries

### Jaloezie be√Ønvloedt onze relatie
**Pronunciation:** yah-loo-ZEE buh-IN-vloot ON-zuh ruh-LAH-tsee

**Meaning:** "Jealousy is affecting our relationship"

**When to use it:** When jealousy becomes problematic.

### Ik heb mijn eigen ruimte nodig
**Pronunciation:** ik hep mayn AY-ghun ROWM-tuh NOH-dikh

**Meaning:** "I need my own space"

**When to use it:** To establish boundaries.

### Vertrouwen is belangrijk voor mij
**Pronunciation:** fur-TROW-un is buh-LAHNG-rayk vohr may

**Meaning:** "Trust is important to me"

**When to use it:** To express your values.

## Dutch Communication Style

The Dutch are famously direct. Discussing jealousy openly is considered mature, not shameful. Expect honest conversation.

Personal autonomy is respected in Dutch culture. Having independent friendships and activities is normal and healthy.

"Vertrouwen" (trust) is built through consistent, honest behavior. Actions matter as much as words.

## Building a Strong Foundation

Discussing jealousy and trust in Dutch allows for clear understanding. These direct conversations, though sometimes uncomfortable, build a healthier relationship. "Vertrouwen is de basis van een goede relatie" (Trust is the foundation of a good relationship).

articles.title: H√∫ngaro para Casais: 40+ Frases Essenciais
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';

import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Comunicar-se com seu parceiro h√∫ngaro vai al√©m de dizer "eu te amo". Vamos explorar as frases essenciais para o dia a dia!

## Cumprimentos do Dia a Dia

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Szia, √©desem!"
  translation="Oi, querido/a!"
  pronunciation="SI-a, E-de-shem"

/>

### Pela Manh√£

<VocabCard
  word="J√≥ reggelt, napf√©nyem"
  translation="Bom dia, meu raio de sol"

/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hogy aludt√°l?"

<VocabCard
  word="R√≥lad √°lmodtam"

  example="R√≥lad √°lmodtam eg√©sz √©jjel."

### √Ä Noite

<VocabCard
  word="J√≥ √©jszak√°t, szerelmem"

/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sz√©p √°lmokat"

  pronunciation="sep AL-mo-kat"
  example="J√≥ √©jszak√°t, sz√©p √°lmokat, kincsem."
/>

## Express√µes de Afeto

<CultureTip title="Expressando Carinho na Hungria" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Os h√∫ngaros s√£o muito apaixonados e expressivos no amor. Use apelidos carinhosos - eles adoram!
</CultureTip>

<VocabCard
  word="Hi√°nyzol"
  translation="Sinto sua falta"

/>

<VocabCard
  word="R√°d gondolok"
  translation="Estou pensando em voc√™"

  example="Mindig r√°d gondolok."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Csod√°latos vagy"
  translation="Voc√™ √© maravilhoso/a"
  pronunciation="CHO-da-la-tosh vadj"
  example="Tudod mit? Csod√°latos vagy."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Im√°dlak"
  translation="Eu adoro voc√™"
  pronunciation="I-mad-lak"
  example="Im√°dlak, √©desem."
/>

## Frases para o Cotidiano

### Fazendo Planos

<VocabCard
  word="Mit szeretn√©l csin√°lni ma?"
  translation="O que voc√™ quer fazer hoje?"
  pronunciation="mit SE-ret-nel CHI-nal-ni ma"
  example="Sz√©p az id≈ë. Mit szeretn√©l csin√°lni ma?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Menj√ºnk s√©t√°lni"
  translation="Vamos dar um passeio"
  pronunciation="MEN-yunk SHE-tal-ni"
  example="Sz√©p az id≈ë, menj√ºnk s√©t√°lni."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Van egy √∂tletem!"
  translation="Tenho uma ideia!"
  pronunciation="van edj OT-le-tem"
  example="Van egy √∂tletem! Menj√ºnk moziba."
/>

### Demonstrando Cuidado

<VocabCard
  word="Minden rendben?"
  translation="Est√° tudo bem?"
  pronunciation="MIN-den REND-ben"
  example="Szomor√∫nak t≈±nsz. Minden rendben?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hogy √©rzed magad?"
  translation="Como voc√™ est√° se sentindo?"
  pronunciation="hodj ER-zed MA-gad"
  example="Hogy √©rzed magad ma, √©desem?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Itt vagyok neked"

/>

## Express√µes de Apoio

<VocabCard
  word="Hiszek benned"

  example="Meg fogod csin√°lni, hiszek benned."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Meg fogod csin√°lni"
  translation="Voc√™ consegue"
  pronunciation="meg FO-god CHI-nal-ni"
  example="Neh√©z, de tudom, hogy meg fogod csin√°lni."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="B√ºszke vagyok r√°d"
  translation="Estou orgulhoso/a de voc√™"
  pronunciation="BUS-ke VA-djok rad"
  example="Nagyszer≈±en csin√°ltad! B√ºszke vagyok r√°d."
/>

## Frases Rom√¢nticas

<VocabCard
  word="Gy√∂ny√∂r≈± vagy"
  translation="Voc√™ √© linda/lindo"
  pronunciation="DJO-nyo-ru vadj"
  example="Gy√∂ny√∂r≈± vagy ma, szerelmem."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Te vagy a legfontosabb ember az √©letemben"
  translation="Voc√™ √© a pessoa mais importante na minha vida"
  pronunciation="te vadj a leg-FON-to-shabb EM-ber az E-le-tem-ben"
  example="Tudod? Te vagy a legfontosabb ember az √©letemben."
/>

## Tabela de Refer√™ncia R√°pida

| H√∫ngaro | Portugu√™s | Quando Usar |
|---------|-----------|-------------|
| Szia! | Oi! | Cumprimento casual |
| Szeretlek | Eu te amo | Declara√ß√£o de amor |
| Hi√°nyzol | Sinto sua falta | Quando est√£o separados |
| Bocs√°nat | Desculpa | Para pedir perd√£o |
| K√∂sz√∂n√∂m | Obrigado/a | Agradecer |
| K√©rlek | Por favor | Pedir algo |
| J√≥ √©jszak√°t | Boa noite | Ao dormir |
| J√≥ reggelt | Bom dia | Pela manh√£ |

## Frases para Resolver Conflitos

<VocabCard
  word="Bocs√°ss meg"
  translation="Me desculpe"
  pronunciation="BO-chash meg"
  example="Bocs√°ss meg. Nem akartam megb√°ntani."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Besz√©lhet√ºnk?"
  translation="Podemos conversar?"
  pronunciation="BE-sel-he-tunk"
  example="K√©rlek, besz√©lhet√ºnk err≈ël?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Megbocs√°tok"
  translation="Eu te perdoo"
  pronunciation="meg-BO-cha-tok"
  example="Tudom, hogy nem akartad. Megbocs√°tok."
/>

<CTA
  text="Pronto para melhorar a comunica√ß√£o com seu parceiro? Love Languages oferece Modo Escuta para jantares em fam√≠lia, o Love Log para salvar frases especiais, e a possibilidade do seu parceiro criar desafios personalizados como tutor."
  buttonText="Come√ßar Gr√°tis"
/>

articles.title: Danca Kƒ±skan√ßlƒ±k ve G√ºven ƒ∞fadeleri
articles.content:
Kƒ±skan√ßlƒ±k, ili≈ükilerde doƒüal bir duygu olabilir. Danca konu≈üan partnerinizle bu konularƒ± saƒülƒ±klƒ± bir ≈üekilde konu≈ümak i√ßin temel ifadeler.

## Kƒ±skan√ßlƒ±ƒüƒ± ƒ∞fade Etme

### 1. "Jeg f√∏ler mig lidt jaloux, n√•r..."
**Telaffuz:** *Yay f√∂ler may lit jalu, nor...*

**Anlam:** "...olduƒüunda biraz kƒ±skan√ß hissediyorum"

### 2. "Kan du berolige mig?"
**Telaffuz:** *Ken du berolige may?*

**Anlam:** "Beni rahatlatabilir misin?"

### 3. "Jeg stoler p√• dig, men ikke p√• dem"
**Telaffuz:** *Yay stoler po day, men ike po dem*

**Anlam:** "Sana g√ºveniyorum, ama onlara g√ºvenmiyorum"

### 4. "Det g√∏r mig utilpas, n√•r..."
**Telaffuz:** *De g√∂r may utilpas, nor...*

**Anlam:** "...olduƒüunda rahatsƒ±z oluyorum"

### 5. "Jeg har brug for at vide, at jeg er din prioritet"
**Telaffuz:** *Yay har bru for at vide, at yay er din prioritet*

**Anlam:** "Senin √∂nceliƒüin olduƒüumu bilmem gerekiyor"

## G√ºven ƒ∞n≈üa Etme

### 6. "Jeg stoler fuldst√¶ndig p√• dig"
**Telaffuz:** *Yay stoler fulstendi po day*

**Anlam:** "Sana tamamen g√ºveniyorum"

### 7. "Du er den eneste for mig"
**Telaffuz:** *Du er den eneste for may*

**Anlam:** "Benim i√ßin tek ki≈üi sensin"

### 8. "Jeg ville aldrig g√∏re noget for at s√•re dig"
**Telaffuz:** *Yay vile aldri g√∂re noyet for at sore day*

**Anlam:** "Seni incitecek hi√ßbir ≈üey yapmam"

### 9. "Du har intet at bekymre dig om"
**Telaffuz:** *Du har intet at bek√ºmare day om*

**Anlam:** "Endi≈üelenecek hi√ßbir ≈üeyin yok"

### 10. "Jeg er kun forpligtet over for dig"
**Telaffuz:** *Yay er kun forpliktet over for day*

**Anlam:** "Sadece sana baƒülƒ±yƒ±m"

### 11. "Lad os tale om dine bekymringer"
**Telaffuz:** *La os tale om dine bek√ºmringer*

**Anlam:** "Endi≈üelerin hakkƒ±nda konu≈üalƒ±m"

### 12. "Hvad kan jeg g√∏re for at du f√∏ler dig mere tryg?"
**Telaffuz:** *Va ken yay g√∂re for at du f√∂ler day mere tr√ºg?*

**Anlam:** "Kendini daha g√ºvende hissetmen i√ßin ne yapabilirim?"

## Danimarka G√ºven K√ºlt√ºr√º

"Skat" (tatlƒ±m) ve "Jeg elsker kun dig" (sadece seni seviyorum) g√ºven veren ifadelerdir.

Bu ifadelerle Danca konu≈üan partnerinizle g√ºven dolu bir ili≈üki kurabilirsiniz.
